alert.note: Alert for Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 12 at 3:17PM EDT until March 15 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM MONDAY TO 8 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York and central and southern Vermont. * WHEN...From 8 PM Monday to 8 AM EDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Tuesday morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures above freezing may initially limit accumulations to grassy, elevated surfaces Monday evening. By Tuesday, snowfall rates are likely to increase, and snow is likely to be heavy at times. Isolated power outages are possible. Gusty winds could produce periods of blowing snow, mainly across higher elevations.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Please allow extra time if travel is necessary.
